title: There’s More Than Meets the Eye to Ramaswamy’s Climate Comment
description: A one-word addition to the usual Republican attack line signals a new approach to the climate crisis.

title: Joe the Plumber, Who Questioned Obama’s Tax Policies During 2008 Campaign, Dead at 49
description: Samuel “Joe” Wurzelbacher, aka “Joe the Plumber” after questioning Barack Obama during the 2008 presidential campaign, has died.

title: Why Shaker Heights’ Progressive Myth Needs a Second Look
description: An interview with Laura Meckler, author of 'Dream Town: Shaker Heights and The Quest For Racial Equity,' about her Ohio hometown.

title: Trump Campaign Reports Raising More Than $7 Million After Georgia Booking
description: The record haul underscores how Trump's legal woes have been a fundraising boon for his campaign, even as his political operation has spent tens of millions on his defense.

title: Forecasters Expect Tropical Storm Idalia Will Become a Hurricane Before it Hits Florida
description: Forecasters predict that Tropical Storm Idalia will become a hurricane by the time it hits Florida on Tuesday, Aug. 29.

title: It Might Be Possible to Reduce Bias in Kids, New Research Suggests
description: What the "Toogits" and the "Flurps" have to do with structural inequality

title: HBO’s Telemarketers Finale Lays Out the Grim State of Modern-Day Telemarketing
description: The third installment of the HBO docuseries lays out the grim state of modern-day telemarketing

title: America Has Reached Peak Therapy. Why Is Our Mental Health Getting Worse?
description: The U.S. has hit peak therapy. So why isn't national mental health improving?

title: Many American Parents Have No Idea How Their Kids Are Doing in School
description: Too many American parents are shockingly in the dark about their child’s actual academic performance

title: What to Know About Drug Price Negotiations That Could Save U.S. Taxpayers Billions
description: The U.S. government is preparing to release a list of 10 drugs that Medicare will be able to negotiate prices for—one of the key elements of President Joe Biden’s Inflation Reduction Act.

title: Pandemics Don’t Really End—They Echo
description: As cases rise again, it's clear that the COVID-19 pandemic will continue to shape American life for years to come

title: What to Know About the Ukraine-War Propaganda Movie in Russian Theaters
description: “The Witness” is the first feature film about the 18-month-old invasion. It depicts Ukrainian troops as violent neo-Nazis who torture and kill their own people.

title: Japan Warns Citizens of Harassment in China Over Nuclear Wastewater Backlash
description: The Ministry of Foreign Affairs said citizens visiting or living in China should avoid speaking Japanese in a loud voice.

title: Foxconn Founder Terry Gou Announces Run for Taiwan Presidency
description: Gou plans to run as an independent, deepening competition among the opposition contenders for the job.

title: China’s Worsening Economic Slowdown Is Rippling Across the Globe
description: China’s economy was meant to drive a third of global economic growth this year, so its dramatic slowdown in recent months is sounding alarm bells across the world.

title: Simone Biles Wins Record 8th U.S. Gymnastics Title
description: The gymnastics star won her record eighth U.S. Championship 10 years after she first ascended to the top of her sport as a teenage prodigy.
